item.title: Ancients arent saving :( (Not a noob question)
item.dc:creator: @Jack_Frost Jack Frost
item.description:
@Jack_Frost wrote:

[quote=“Kitno, post:5, topic:107950”][quote author=PatScape link=topic=154508.msg1456674#msg1456674 date=1181420837]
Specify more of what you want. Do you want it to save that you have the ancients tab on/ off?

Aha, try putting what I said in client.java, instead of playerhandler. I forgot to specify that, tell me if that works. ^^[/quote]

Put ALL of it in client.java? It saves right, but I have to go to my character-file and make “character-ancients= 0” to 1. And then after I log out it goes back to 0. -.-[/quote]

im pretty sure you talking about ancient spells.

but your talking about character files so i’ll take a stab in the dark, if your trying to edit a char. file you need to have the person signed off

item.title: Ancients arent saving :( (Not a noob question)
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

search for

[code]lastlogintime =

Integer.parseInt(token2);[/code]

put this right after:

[code]else if (token.equals

(“character-ancients”)) {
ancients = Integer.parseInt

(token2);
}[/code]

search for:Integer.toString(playerLastLogin).length()); characterfile.newLine();

this after:

[code]characterfile.write("character-ancients = ", 0, 21);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(ancients), 0,

Integer.toString(ancients).length());
characterfile.newLine();[/code]

Should save to your file now.

Read full topic
item.source: Ancients arent saving :( (Not a noob question)

item.title: Ancients arent saving :( (Not a noob question)
item.dc:creator: @Kitno Kitno
item.description:
@Kitno wrote:

Im using Whitescape.

I have this already

if(ancients == 0) { setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); } if(ancients == 1) { setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); }

and I have added this (thanks PatScape)

else if (token.equals("character-ancients")) { ancients = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

and Ive added this (Thanks PatScape) into my playerhandler

characterfile.write("character-ancients = ", 0, 21); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(plr.ancients), 0, Integer.toString(ancients).length()); characterfile.newLine();

The only way it saves now is if I edit it manually into my character-file. so it’s obviously not saving right, still. Help please.

But ancients arent saving because I dont have the code in playerhandler.java etc etc. Please help.

Read full topic
